item.title: Word of the Day: truculent
item.description: This word has appeared in 18 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel Teases ‘Melania’
item.description: The late night host said, “Not since ‘The Terminator’ has there been this much excitement for a movie about a European cyborg.”

The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)

item.title: China y el Reino Unido acuerdan fortalecer relaciones para evitar a un EE. UU. volátil
item.description: El viaje del primer ministro británico a Pekín es la más reciente de una serie de visitas de dirigentes a China, diseñadas para proyectar al país como la alternativa estable a un Estados Unidos impredecible.
item.dc:creator: David Pierson

media:content.media:credit: Carl Court/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Chinese and British delegations participating in a meeting between President Xi Jinping and Prime Minister Keir Starmer in Beijing on Thursday.

item.title: Trump’s Board of Peace Is Anything But
item.description: America has conveniently forgotten that it once took the world to end conflicts.
item.dc:creator: Thant Myint-U
item.category: United Nations Department of Peacekeeping Operations

media:content.media:credit: FPG/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: A United Nations chamber in New York City around 1947.

item.title: The End of Nuclear Arms Control
item.description: Once the New START treaty ends, we will have returned to an era without limits, when arsenals can reach unconstrained heights.
item.dc:creator: W.J. Hennigan
item.category: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament

media:content.media:credit: An-My Lê for The New York Times

item.title: The Secret Sauce in ‘Heated Rivalry’? Canada.
item.description: The global television phenomenon is full of Canadian iconography and subsidized by Canadian taxpayers. On Thursday, it came home to celebrate.
item.dc:creator: Matina Stevis-Gridneff and Cole Burston

media:content.media:credit: Cole Burston for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and Heated Rivalry actor Hudson Williams on the red carpet at a conference for the Canadian Media Producers Association in Ottawa on Thursday.

media:content.media:credit: Cole Burston for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and Heated Rivalry actor Hudson Williams on the red carpet at a conference for the Canadian Media Producers Association in Ottawa on Thursday.

item.title: Panama Court Strikes Down Hong Kong Firm’s Canal Contract
item.description: President Trump has said he wants American control of the canal, putting the longtime ports operator, CK Hutchison, in the cross-hairs of the U.S.-China trade conflict.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Stevenson and Peter Eavis

media:content.media:credit: Nathalia Angarita for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump has frequently said he wants the United States to retake control of the Panama Canal.

item.title: South Korean Stocks, Kospi Index Are Trading at a Record High
item.description: Spurred by government policies and the global A.I. boom, the market’s value has jumped by hundreds of billions of dollars. Individual investors have piled in.
item.dc:creator: Jin Yu Young

media:content.media:credit: Ahn Young-Joon/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Traders at a bank celebrating the returns of the benchmark Kospi index, which has more than doubled in the past year.

item.description: Quotation of the Day for Friday, January 30, 2026.

item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Friday, Jan. 30, 2026.

item.title: How Childhood Play Dates Turned Into an Eventual Wedding Date
item.description: Bevan Cohen and Ryan Boesky grew up together. He had a crush on her in kindergarten; it wasn’t reciprocated until high school.
item.dc:creator: Sophia June

item.title: He Planned Two More Dates Before the First Week Ended
item.description: Samantha Lesser and Michael Wald met through family connections and quickly found themselves planning what came next.
item.dc:creator: Donna Kim

item.title: Love Took Flight With Birds of a Feather
item.description: Emily Diamond and David Meadows are serious birders who found each other on Hinge.

item.title: ‘Hey, How’s It Going? I’m Filing for Divorce Now.’
item.description: Marriage is hard. It can be even harder when you don’t believe you deserve to be loved in the first place.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Huiyang Wang

media:content.media:credit: Brian Rea

item.title: How Benjamin Franklin Helped Bring Them Together
item.description: Breana Teubner and Peter McGuiness hit it off on their first date. She asked him to name a favorite autobiography. His answer impressed.
item.dc:creator: Linda Marx

item.title: Trump Expected to Announce Kevin Warsh as Fed Chair
item.description: President Trump is set to announce his choice to replace Jerome H. Powell as chair of the Federal Reserve, saying it is someone “known to everybody in the financial world.”
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith and Tyler Pager

media:content.media:credit: Ann Saphir/Reuters
media:content.media:description: President Trump is planning to announce Kevin M. Warsh, a former Federal Reserve governor, as his choice to replace Jerome H. Powell.

item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney hugs Hudson Williams, the Canadian actor.

item.title: Trump Threatens Canada Over Business Jet Dispute
item.description: The president said he would restrict the use of Canadian-built aircraft and impose a 50 percent tariff on them until the dispute was resolved.
item.dc:creator: Niraj Chokshi, Ian Austen and Karoun Demirjian

media:content.media:credit: Desiree Rios/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A SkyWest Airlines airplane landing at Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport in Dallas in 2023. SkyWest has the most Canadian-built aircraft of any operator.

item.title: ‘The Pitt’ Season 2 Episode 4 Recap: Wanna Bet?
item.description: A nearby hospital closes its doors temporarily, sending extra patients and chaos to the Pitt. Time for another office pool.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins

media:content.media:credit: Warrick Page/HBO Max
media:content.media:description: Dr. McKay (Fiona Dourif) took a gamble all her own by asking out a patient.

item.title: Trump Sues I.R.S. Over Tax Data Leak, Demanding $10 Billion
item.description: The president charged that the I.R.S. and the Treasury Department had failed to prevent a former I.R.S. contractor from gaining access to documents shared with news outlets.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Duehren and Chris Cameron

media:content.media:credit: Haiyun Jiang for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The Internal Revenue Service office building in Washington last year.

item.title: Xi’s Military Purge May Set Back His Taiwan Ambitions
item.description: By ousting his top generals, Xi Jinping has secured absolute control, but has also hollowed out the command structure preparing for possible war over Taiwan.
item.dc:creator: Chris Buckley

media:content.media:credit: Ng Han Guan/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Gen. Zhang Youxia was China’s top general until he was placed under investigation in a stunning escalation of Xi Jinping’s purge of the military elite.

item.title: Newsom Files Civil Rights Complaint Against Dr. Oz Over Fraud Video
item.description: Dr. Mehmet Oz, a top federal health official, posted a video that accuses Armenian Americans in California of health care fraud.

media:content.media:credit: Alex Wong/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Dr. Mehmet Oz, administrator for the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, speaking at the White House earlier this month.

item.title: War Threats and Ambiguous Evidence: Trump Again Confronts Iran
item.description: There is little sign that Iran has made significant progress in reconstituting its nuclear program, leaving questions about the timing and motive behind potential plans for further attacks.
item.dc:creator: Mark Mazzetti, Julian E. Barnes, David E. Sanger and Ronen Bergman
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Arash Khamooshi for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Little has happened in the past six months to indicate that Iran has made significant strides toward rebuilding its capacity to enrich nuclear fuel and fashion a nuclear warhead.

item.title: Maps: Where the U.S. Is Building Up Military Force Near Iran
item.description: President Trump has not authorized military action in Iran, but the U.S. has built up its presence in the region in recent days.
item.dc:creator: Christoph Koettl, Eric Schmitt, Ashley Cai and Daniel Wood
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: 24 secretos para una vida más saludable
item.description: Médicos, terapeutas y autores comparten mucha sabiduría en unas cuantas palabras.

item.title: Did Trump Really Give Nicki Minaj a $1 Million ‘Gold Card’ Visa?
item.description: “Gold Trump card free of charge,” the rapper wrote on social media. But the White House says it’s not what it seems.
item.dc:creator: Zolan Kanno-Youngs

media:content.media:credit: Allison Robbert for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The rapper Nicki Minaj greeting President Trump during an event in Washington on Wednesday. She is originally from Trinidad and Tobago and grew up in Queens.

item.title: Trump Weighs New Military Options Against Iran
item.description: The plans being weighed by the president go beyond those he considered weeks ago amid widespread protests against Iran’s government.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Pager, Julian E. Barnes, Eric Schmitt, David E. Sanger and Helene Cooper
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Doug Mills/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The options go beyond the proposals that Mr. Trump was considering two weeks ago as a means of following through on his promise to stop the killing of protesters by Iranian government security forces and affiliated militias.

item.title: Brendan Banfield Denies Plot in Double Murder Trial, Calling Accusations ‘Crazy’
item.description: Brendan Banfield rebuffed claims that he had made an elaborate plan for the killings with the family’s au pair, with whom he had an affair.
item.dc:creator: Jacey Fortin

media:content.media:credit: Tom Brenner/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Brendan Banfield arriving to court in his double murder trial in Fairfax, Va., earlier this month.

item.title: ‘Marty Supreme’ and the Shame Game
item.description: Wesley Morris and Sasha Weiss, a culture editor at The New York Times Magazine, talk about “Marty Supreme” and play the shame game.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Rocklin

item.title: Venezuela reforma el sector petrolero
item.description: Cediendo a las presiones del gobierno de Trump, la nueva legislación mejora las condiciones para las empresas petroleras extranjeras y abre el camino para reducir drásticamente los impuestos que pagan.
item.dc:creator: Simon Romero

media:content.media:credit: Adriana Loureiro Fernandez para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Una estatua de una mano que sostiene una plataforma de perforación cerca de la compañía petrolera estatal de Venezuela, el año pasado.

item.title: Video Shows Bovino’s Orders to Immigration Agents in L.A. Raids
item.description: The Border Patrol commander gave agents wide latitude to arrest people as immigration raids began last summer. Similar tactics were later used in other cities.
item.dc:creator: Jesus Jiménez

item.title: Video Shows Bovino Giving Orders to Federal Agents in Los Angeles
item.description: Video from last summer shows the Border Patrol official Gregory Bovino telling federal agents dressed in tactical gear to “arrest as many people that touch you as you want.” The video was made public as part of a federal lawsuit over immigration enforcement in the Chicago area.
item.dc:creator: Jackeline Luna

item.title: Washington Post Plans Cuts to Reshape Newsroom
item.description: The changes are expected to include significant layoffs in areas like sports and international coverage.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wemple, Katie Robertson and Benjamin Mullin

media:content.media:credit: Justin T. Gellerson for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The Washington Post’s newsroom in 2017.

item.title: Can Trust in Vaccines Be Built Through Skepticism?
item.description: Is the Trump administration reviving confidence in vaccination or destroying it? Dr. Jay Bhattacharya, the director of the N.I.H., thinks an embrace of skepticism is key.

media:content.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: Melania Trump Documentary Premiere: Who Was at the Kennedy Center
item.description: Top White House officials streamed into the Kennedy Center on Thursday for a screening of Amazon’s new documentary about the first lady, Melania Trump.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk
item.category: Kennedy, John F, Center for the Performing Arts

media:content.media:credit: Doug Mills/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump and the first lady, Melania Trump, arriving at the Kennedy Center on Thursday for the premiere of “Melania,” Amazon’s new documentary about Mrs. Trump.

item.title: Kennedy Overhauls Federal Autism Panel in His Own Image
item.description: The new panel, which advises the government on research and service priorities for people with autism, includes many members who have argued that vaccines cause the disorder.
item.dc:creator: Azeen Ghorayshi

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Although the panel only serves an advisory function, many longtime autism advocates and researchers were alarmed by some of the new panel members.

item.title: What Domestic Terrorism Means, and Doesn’t
item.description: The Trump administration has called the Minneapolis shooting victims “domestic terrorists.” Our criminal justice reporter Jonah E. Bromwich explains what that term actually means.
item.dc:creator: Jonah E. Bromwich, Gilad Thaler, Sutton Raphael and Thomas Vollkommer

item.title: Minnesota State Senate Fields Testimony on ICE Violence in Twin Cities
item.description: In an hourslong hearing, lawmakers heard stories of the use of racial profiling and aggressive tactics against state residents.

media:content.media:credit: Octavio Jones/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: A demonstration against ICE outside the State Capitol in St. Paul, Minn., earlier this month.

item.title: What to Know About Anti-ICE Protests This Weekend
item.description: Organizers are trying to build on the momentum of a strike last week that brought thousands into the streets in Minneapolis.
item.dc:creator: Sonia A. Rao

media:content.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Demonstrators braved freezing temperatures to protest the immigration crackdown.

item.title: California Jury Convicts Ex-Google Engineer of Stealing AI Secrets
item.description: A federal jury found that Linwei Ding stole thousands of confidential files to help him start a company in Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Tripp Mickle

media:content.media:credit: Kelsey McClellan for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The case is one of several that have surfaced in recent years against Chinese nationals in the United States as the fight for technological dominance ramps up.

item.title: Map: Where ICE Has Had Access to Minnesota Jails and Prisons
item.description: About 30 percent of the people ICE detained in Minnesota last year were turned over by local jails and prisons, a New York Times analysis of federal data shows, but that number is a lower share than in 39 other states.
item.dc:creator: Albert Sun

item.title: Democrats Reach a Deal With the White House
item.description: Also, genes may determine longevity, a new study finds. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.

item.title: Michael Beck, 65, Dies; First to Report Symptoms of ‘Havana Syndrome’
item.description: As an employee with the N.S.A., he claimed he was exposed to a direct-energy device that led to a diagnosis of Parkinson’s disease at the age of 45.
item.dc:creator: Clay Risen

media:content.media:credit: Katherine Frey/The Washington Post, via Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Michael Beck in 2017. He said he began experiencing debilitating symptoms of Havana Syndrome much earlier than many other federal employees.

item.title: How to Make Friends as an Adult: 11 Ways to Build Lasting Connections
item.description: A practical guide for expanding your circle, with advice from sociable people.

item.title: The Polls Are Clear. Americans Don’t Want This.

item.title: Trump Says Putin Agreed to a Weeklong Pause in Attacks Amid Extreme Cold
item.description: Russia has left thousands of apartment buildings in Kyiv without heat in recent weeks, in a campaign that has appeared aimed at breaking Ukraine’s morale.

media:content.media:credit: Sergei Gapon/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: A building in Kyiv protected by sandbags on Thursday.

item.title: Trump and First Lady Attend Premiere of ‘Melania’ at Kennedy Center
item.description: Amazon paid Melania Trump’s production company $40 million for the movie and then paid another $35 million to promote it.

item.title: La tormenta invernal podría traer nevadas atípicas a la costa este de EE. UU.
item.description: Se espera que una gran tormenta provoque fuertes nevadas, vientos intensos, grandes olas e inundaciones en algunas zonas de la costa oriental del país durante el fin de semana.
item.dc:creator: Nazaneen Ghaffar and Erin McCann

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
